sampleArticles: New Rules Could Force Tesla to Redesign Its Door Handles. That’s Harder Than It Sounds

articles: New Rules Could Force Tesla to Redesign Its Door Handles. That’s Harder Than It Sounds
summaries: China's proposed regulations would ban flush door handles on cars and require mechanical releases, forcing automakers like Tesla to redesign their electronic handles by mid-2027, a change that presents significant engineering and manufacturing challenges.

rawData.title: TiVo no longer makes DVRs
rawData.summary: TiVo has officially ended production and sales of DVR hardware after 26 years, with the company now focusing on software for smart TVs and vehicle infotainment systems while continuing to support existing hardware.

rawData.title: Facebook is adding job listings, again
rawData.summary: Facebook is reintroducing free job listings in its Marketplace section, focusing on local entry-level, service, and trade work positions in the US, after previously retiring the feature in 2023.

rawData.title: Hackers can steal 2FA codes and private messages from Android phones
rawData.summary: A new attack called 'Pixnapping' allows malicious Android apps to steal 2FA codes, private messages, and other sensitive data by exploiting screen rendering timing, requiring no permissions and working in under 30 seconds.

rawData.title: Microsoft AI announces first image generator created in-house
rawData.summary: Microsoft has announced MAI-Image-1, its first in-house text-to-image generator, which specializes in photorealistic imagery and has already ranked in the top 10 on AI benchmark site LMArena.

rawData.title: WIRED'S Favorite PC Monitor Is $75 Off
rawData.summary: Dell's 27 Plus 4K monitor, featuring a 120Hz refresh rate and IPS panel, is on sale for $228 (24% off), offering good color accuracy and built-in speakers suitable for home office use.

rawData.title: Is the AI Conveyor Belt of Capital About to Stop?
rawData.summary: Recent major AI investment deals between tech giants (Nvidia, OpenAI, Oracle) show potentially circular money movements, raising concerns about artificial value creation. While these companies claim the investments will drive AI advancement and adoption, current enterprise ROI remains low despite soaring stock valuations.

rawData.title: Google will let you hide sponsored results in search — after you’ve seen them
rawData.summary: Google is introducing a new feature that allows users to collapse sponsored search results after viewing them, with paid results now grouped under a single collapsible section with a prominent 'sponsored' label.

rawData.title: Tesla Cybertruck sales are flatlining
rawData.summary: Tesla Cybertruck sales dropped 63% in Q3 2025 with only 5,385 units sold, while competing electric trucks from Rivian, Ford, and GMC saw significant sales increases during the same period.

rawData.title: New California law requires AI to tell you it’s AI
rawData.summary: California has passed SB 243, requiring AI chatbots to clearly disclose their artificial nature when users might reasonably believe they're interacting with humans, and mandating annual reports to the Office of Suicide Prevention about user safety measures.

rawData.title: California enacts its own internet age-gating law
rawData.summary: California has enacted a new law requiring device operating systems and app stores to verify users' ages during device setup, with enforcement beginning January 2027 and potential fines up to $7,500 per child for intentional violations.

rawData.title: Nvidia’s ‘personal AI supercomputer’ goes on sale October 15th
rawData.summary: Nvidia's DGX Spark, a desktop-sized AI supercomputer capable of running sophisticated AI models with up to 200 billion parameters, will launch October 15th for $3,999. The device delivers a petaflop of AI performance while running on standard power and will be available both directly from Nvidia and through major PC manufacturers offering customized versions.

rawData.title: Apple TV Plus is being rebranded to… Apple TV
rawData.summary: Apple is rebranding its streaming service Apple TV Plus to simply 'Apple TV', though this may cause confusion with its existing hardware and app of the same name.

rawData.title: Why Signal’s post-quantum makeover is an amazing engineering achievement
rawData.summary: Signal has implemented a quantum-resistant upgrade to its encryption protocol using ML-KEM-768, addressing the challenge of larger key sizes while maintaining forward secrecy and post-compromise security features in its messaging system.

rawData.title: Four Ways to Solve AI's Heat Problem
rawData.summary: As AI chips consume increasingly more power (up to 1,200W for newest GPUs), data centers are shifting from traditional air cooling to liquid cooling solutions. Four main approaches are emerging: single-phase direct-to-chip water cooling, two-phase direct-to-chip cooling, single-phase immersion, and two-phase immersion cooling.

rawData.title: EcoFlow’s Delta Pro Ultra X can power a home for weeks
rawData.summary: EcoFlow announced the Delta Pro Ultra X home battery backup system with 12kW continuous output (up to 36kW in parallel) and scalable capacity from 12kWh to 180kWh, capable of powering a home for up to six days at full capacity.

rawData.title: OpenAI partners with Broadcom to produce its own AI chips
rawData.summary: OpenAI is partnering with Broadcom to develop custom AI chips for its data centers, aiming to deploy 10 gigawatts of custom AI accelerators by 2029 as part of its strategy to reduce dependence on Nvidia.

rawData.title: California becomes first state to regulate AI companion chatbots | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: California has passed SB 243, becoming the first state to regulate AI companion chatbots, requiring companies to implement safety protocols including age verification, suicide prevention measures, and content restrictions to protect children and vulnerable users.

rawData.title: Palmer Luckey’s Anduril launches EagleEye military helmet with help from buddy Zuck
rawData.summary: Anduril, founded by Oculus creator Palmer Luckey, has partnered with Meta to launch EagleEye, an AI-powered mixed-reality helmet system for military use that includes heads-up display, spatial audio, and drone control capabilities.

rawData.title: Vivo X300 Pro launches with an Ultra-rivaling camera
rawData.summary: Vivo launches X300 and X300 Pro flagship phones with advanced camera systems featuring a 200MP Samsung HPB sensor and support for a snap-on telephoto extender lens, previously exclusive to their Ultra model.

rawData.title: UK fines 4Chan over online safety compliance
rawData.summary: UK regulator Ofcom has fined 4Chan £20,000 for ignoring legally-binding information requests related to Online Safety Act investigations, with additional daily penalties of £100 to be imposed until compliance.
